CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: 10,11 Generally , when considering that open circuit voltage ( V oc ) is related to the difference between the highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) energy level of donor materials and the lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy level of acceptor , 12,13 deep HOMO levels for low band gap conjugated polymers are preferred in order to attain high V oc .

Let's think step by step.

1. "open circuit voltage (Voc)" - Voc is a property of a material, so it can be considered a material name.
2. "highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) energy level" - HOMO is a property of a material, specifically a type of molecular orbital, so it can be considered a material name.
3. "lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) energy level" - LUMO is a property of a material, specifically a type of molecular orbital, so it can be considered a material name.
4. "low band gap conjugated polymers" - Conjugated polymers are a type of material, so this can be considered a material name.

Note: The other terms in the paragraph, such as "donor materials" and "acceptor," are not specific enough to be considered material names on their own, as they could refer to any material that acts as a donor or acceptor.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

* open circuit voltage (Voc)
* highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) energy level
* lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) energy level
* low band gap conjugated polymers

Note: The other terms in the paragraph, such as "donor materials" and "acceptor," are not specific enough to be considered material names on their own, as they could refer to any material that acts as a donor or acceptor.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| open circuit voltage (Voc) |
| highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO) energy level |
| lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO) energy level |
| low band gap conjugated polymers |
